remarks: If two categories have the same set of objects, morphisms, and compositions, then they have the same monomorphisms.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
statement:
monpropd.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( Homf ` C ) = ( Homf ` D ) ) $.
monpropd.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( comf ` C ) = ( comf ` D ) ) $.
monpropd.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
monpropd.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Cat ) $.
monpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( Mono ` C ) = ( Mono ` D ) ) $.
